tests.sic.sST.norm

Class sSTCnormFastHeur2Opt

  • java.lang.Object
    • tests.sic.sST.norm.sSTCnormFastHeur2Opt
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    OptimizerIntf

    public final class sSTCnormFastHeur2Opt
extends java.lang.Object
implements OptimizerIntf
    class computes an approximate solution to the (s,S,T) policy optimization under normal demands, by computing near-optimal (r,nQ,T) policy parameters r*,Q*, and T* according to the heuristic implemented in class tests.sic.rnqt.norm.RnQTCnormHeurOpt and then computing the best (s(r*),S(r*+Q*)) parameters for t close to T* and picking the best set of parameters.

    Title: popt4jlib

    Description: A Parallel Meta-Heuristic Optimization Library in Java

    Copyright: Copyright (c) 2011-2021

    Company:

    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Ioannis T. Christou

      • minimize

        public PairObjDouble minimize(FunctionIntf f)
                       throws OptimizerException
        main class method, creates sets of function evaluations as tasks to be submitted to the cluster, for more parallelization.
        Specified by:
        minimize in interface OptimizerIntf
        Parameters:
        f - FunctionIntf must be of type sSTCnorm
        Returns:
        PairObjDouble Pair<double[] args, double bestcost> where the args is an array holding the parameters (s*,S*,T*) yielding the bestcost value
        Throws:
        OptimizerException

      • minimizeOverT

        public PairObjDouble minimizeOverT(FunctionIntf f)
                            throws OptimizerException
        main class method, as originally implemented. This implementation creates one task for each different T to be tried. The problem is that usually there are few different T's to try, and therefore any extra CPU cores will go unused. Instead, we can have as a single task, a single (or small set of) function evaluations and send them to the network for parallel processing.
        Parameters:
        f - FunctionIntf must be of type sSTCnorm
        Returns:
        PairObjDouble Pair<double[] args, double bestcost> where the args is an array holding the parameters (s*,S*,T*) yielding the bestcost value
        Throws:
        OptimizerException

      • getLatestTimeSeries

        public java.util.ArrayList[] getLatestTimeSeries()
        get the time-series from the latest run.
        Returns:
        ArrayList[] first element is T-axis values, second is optimal costs

      • terminateServerConnection

        public void terminateServerConnection()
        a thread may call this method at any point to terminate the sole connection to the workers' network. The method will terminate the connection as soon as there is no other thread running the minimize(f) method.

      • getOptimalRnQTPolicy

        private double[] getOptimalRnQTPolicy(sSTCnorm f)
                               throws OptimizerException
        find a near-optimal (r,nQ,T) policy for a system operating with the parameters contained in the given function, and return the optimal review period T*. Uses the heuristic described in the CAIE paper by Christou, Skouri and Lagodimos (2020).
        Parameters:
        f - sSTCnorm
        Returns:
        double[] near-optimal parameters for the (r,nQ,T) policy
        Throws:
        OptimizerException
